title.value: Probabilistic Surrogate Networks for Simulators with Unbounded Randomness
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the document and reflects the main topic discussed in the research.
title.quote: Probabilistic Surrogate Networks for Simulators with Unbounded Randomness

extractions.description: The paper introduces a framework for automatically structuring and training deep neural surrogates for stochastic simulators with unbounded randomness. The surrogates retain the structure of the simulators and enable faster simulations and posterior inference. The framework is particularly suited for simulators with an arbitrary number of random variables, focusing on applications like materials quality testing and Bayesian inference with probabilistic programming.

type.justification: The paper discusses a novel approach and framework for surrogate modeling, focusing on the theoretical development and advantages of Probabilistic Surrogate Networks without emphasizing experimental evaluation.
type.quote: We have proposed probabilistic surrogate networks, a novel approach to surrogate modeling that considers not only the distributions in stochastic simulators but the stochastic structure of the simulator itself.

name.justification: The primary research field of the paper is Probabilistic Programming, as it focuses on probabilistic surrogate networks and their application in probabilistic programming paradigms to enhance inference in simulators.
name.quote: The probabilistic programming paradigm equates a generative model with a program written in a probabilistic programming language (PPL).

name.justification: Surrogate modeling is a major theme in the paper as it introduces a new framework for surrogate modeling of simulators with unbounded randomness.
name.quote: We present a framework for automatically structuring and training fast, approximate, deep neural surrogates of stochastic simulators.

name.justification: The paper discusses Bayesian inference over latent variables in simulators as a key application for the proposed surrogate networks.
name.quote: In this paper we illustrate how PSNs leverage faster inference by employing them in conjunction with the neural network based inference compilation (IC) framework.

name.justification: The use of deep neural networks as part of the surrogate modeling framework indicates the relevance to the deep learning field.
name.quote: Our surrogates, which we call probabilistic surrogate networks (PSNs), do not suffer from being an under-approximation.

name.justification: Probabilistic Surrogate Networks are the central model proposed in the paper, focusing on surrogates for simulators with unbounded randomness.
name.quote: Our surrogates, which we call probabilistic surrogate networks (PSNs), do not suffer from being an under-approximation.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces Probabilistic Surrogate Networks as a novel contribution to surrogate modeling for simulators.
is_contributed.quote: We have proposed probabilistic surrogate networks, a novel approach to surrogate modeling that considers not only the distributions in stochastic simulators but the stochastic structure.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses execution scenarios of the PSNs in the context of simulations and inference tasks.
is_executed.quote: The surrogate samples a new address from the transition distribution, a value is sampled from the distribution at the sampled address.

is_compared.justification: The performance of PSNs is compared to ground truth and existing methods in the experiments section.
is_compared.quote: Inference using IC in the simulator and using IC in the PSN both are identical to GT.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper introduces Probabilistic Surrogate Networks as a novel model, hence there would be no earlier references for it.

name.justification: The paper uses synthetic datasets in its experiments to evaluate the proposed framework.
name.quote: We present an experiment that highlights the PSN’s capability to learn a model’s address transitions.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The datasets used are synthetic, created for the purpose of the experiments, thus no reference paper is provided.

name.justification: PyProb is explicitly mentioned as a tool used for probabilistic programming and inference in the paper.
name.quote: PyProb is a probabilistic programming language (PPL) that enables Bayesian inference in stochastic simulators written in other programming languages.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to PyProb is directly mentioned in relation to its use for Bayesian inference in stochastic simulators.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Atilim Gunes Baydin and Tuan Anh Le. pyprob. https://github.com/probprog/pyprob, 2018.
